jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

E0EE405F31044C1EB6E8CE1F18FB75CD.description: CSIS5: Recite prayers and poems of substance that encourage all to strive for virtue and goodness.

5C4052F93023466C9E6E42D0F6BD4909.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

4C8A7C2563DA42CD9311674D713E0C35.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or
themes.

9060A9ACFC4644FAA59E63737AE9D4E4.description: Report on a topic/text (including Catholic/religious topics) or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

F3FC7DEA8C594DA5BAE87D2B7868911E.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

695050605A564E75A721C43114DC3A62.description: Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

E0E5C85A166447A6A98BF7B5E0278881.description: Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

3AE8139073E243A2AD226AF03A64C932.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others in a respectful
manner.

C636855010C547CE87E9D1159240F488.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

895C526E2B0047CFBD9086F75A5AFC91.description:
Come to discussions prepared having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the
topic to explore ideas under discussion.

E9B999A415174011AAD7B106F032AFA1.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in diverse groups, and teacher-led), building on others’ ideas and expressing their
own clearly.

F990C8576EAC41CAA6DE91FE19814087.description: Share the beauty and cadence of poetry for its impact on human sensibilities and formation of the soul. CSDS9

AF6F2521FDEE4FB8BC681951E3E3618D.description: Delight and wonder through reading aloud or listening to creative, sound, and healthy stories, and poems and plays. CSDS7

CA9353C4D3954E4FBD5B564644C5D8BA.description: Share beautifully told and well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

45EC495D8FAD43439DAA8AEF5A85B80C.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

E96429F452DB4B2E88C51DF7CC2FF9D6.description: Listen attentively and display appropriate reverence during prayer time and in Church.

D0CCAC4FBABC4D74853CD739F0FF9666.description: Catholic Standards for Speaking and Listening

9EAF9804BB5C445AB0CB32B921D348EE.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and
other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

A82C230CA7D74B2292480FE5CBAF0BE5.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

D7442A6D1124452B88753899DCEFAABD.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

9A3282605E7A4C18BF05BE6C47CB98C0.description: Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

1A7904EE47F34F8B8CB2A84FADF51B9C.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

EEC061DD210A4FA38D3BDB34ED4395B7.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the
precise meaning of key words and phrases.

0EC0AA69DB5D4270AA38E8EA7B23EE44.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

3CE75D851E144C9C87269CD1CC901593.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

891BE3D2740D4DED8982B35C2BCED078.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on Grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a
range of strategies.

DCCC9EB87D914DB1909700A460BCC87A.description: Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, formal/informal) used in stories, dramas, or poems.

EF081615D48D45C9B5E9A42412749141.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

B3D44CBC44B5449C96C91EF8F310F780.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

F91254FD0B5F4B0FBC51C5964817D3C1.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

96B1FD1E7E8E4E18893400D1CB5356F4.description: Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

D4137927BCCE4ABD8580517E75A93F53.description:
Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It’s true, isn’t it?), and
to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

BAF35451BEF54373B7B68334ED5098E3.description: Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.

889B81A570484A6FB42A9A4AD519DC0F.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

844C23DFDCE84BF5B677FE5171BCEAD3.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

513A3C556CC54ACF98D1D8368C9B78A4.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

36F027C105A44ED883D1D24D27F8A132.description: Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

C9F0E2E2C4D64C85AD2A477D367BAEDE.description: Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

724B8D7E8F80487DB01AEF065500CE5A.description: Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.

06FD77B520EF4DABB593FA90D503D7EE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

EBD9C8A9130B457EA2C060B041736BC3.description: Use language to order our thoughts and to accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

638113E9D12443C0B78370B242FCCF02.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

7FC73CCD254F4493A86669390A09D1AC.description: Exhibit an understanding that words are important to the Word.

426C9FC309D3420A8840E8A6E1B20C81.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range
of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

56EF63C5EE8A4CA29E668AE89E68302B.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

7071DAAE56204482B1FA3BB35E0057A9.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes
and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

F0B54F20D29C46C588CDCFC9797D5664.description: Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

E62635F4825841158C51F862ABB5C8A9.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

0D3D36E81CB24D1DB60B4303846F1874.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate
with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

F9840DC4B382495A9427DDE4B9F34D6D.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new
approach.

AE50D0B4EFDF404686759EF7D5CD535A.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience (include prayers and
meditations).

7344286407B4438891C88250715C504B.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

AB37AB86397E432396646ACB4B8C9F8A.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

65420065ADD84B1A821F7D3CE8EFC8E3.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

51EDC3766C544A9DAD04AE8338E63BF1.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to
situations.

60419E4684B24D9B86DCF9BA9EBCC4D2.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

B2958168CAA84D689A2C9F5F3E01D511.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences

5FA2810F3C3D402FBD2F5F7E50B2F579.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

297BA7A520DF43C7A0BA9986C961053A.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

22F1002986D04F2EBBA76DD0C02F0E64.description: Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

D5F91E67EF06416CBC8C8E9091161DCC.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

7AE59D1010A94DF7A123B36FB80FAD41.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and group related information logically; include formatting (e.g., headings),
illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

585158FD24E844EDAE13726621626B19.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic (including Catholic/religious topics) and convey ideas and information clearly.

370B610C1BDC46D389C28DB035DA7F2B.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

4BC3465BD56F4DA780BB30289FE15053.description: Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).

1C74EA086AC34E52AF78C6E53D65CCAC.description: Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.

AB48BED8CDCB43CFB479AFEDF424A704.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s
purpose.

76AC3CEF4B994499B552E3168EE9400B.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts (including Catholic/religious topics), supporting a point of view with reasons, information and reflecting Catholic
values.

C0AC226F29724C4AB522A07D096BBDC9.description: CSDS8: Write stories about characters possessing virtue and begin to exhibit these virtuous behaviors and attitudes.

0D8A0F65EB804AC188F56B6E09A906B2.description: CSIS14: Write to explore reasoning and intent

64BC15D6E6694ABB9F780389EB2B1BBF.description: CSIS8: Write to develop personal judgment based on truth, goodness and virtue.

D6EB10AE71D649C28FC071AF3765B590.description: CSIS2: Write how spiritual knowledge and truth are represented and communicated through fairy tales, fables, myths, parables, and stories.

26C8DCA3F99A4C86BFC295BEC8BB3DE0.description: Write in ways to order our thoughts, align them with truth, and accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

C7AC450DBE6A48719304D10634228F1C.description: Share well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

065F205961814EF2A0545602984EDE07.description: Create written works that glorify the Creator, reflect the heart of the Redeemer and are inspired by the Spirit.
